page.title: 11HUNWICK VILLAGE
page.content: One of the most interesting things in Hunwick is the village green.On it is an old "gin" or engine house for horse powered machinery.To the North there is a hall called Helmington Hall which is part of a much larger house of 1686.Hunwick Hall is the other very old building.There were once pipeworks and brickworks in Hunwick because of good clay deposits,but the pipeworks have closed.The brickworks however are thriving,being a specialist firm producing refactory products.Once there was a railway station in Hunwick,the railway line connecting Bishop Auckland and Durham.This was uproated in the 1950s.There were remains of a Roman Road in Hunwick, but they were ploughed up.The road probably went to Binchester Roman Fort which is across the River Wear.
